titleStmt.title: A besome of truth, to sweep away the refuge of lies, or, Something in answer to one Francis Holdcraft (priest) a prisoner in Cambridge Castle ... also the ground of the difference shewed between the people (in scorn called Quakers) and some other separated people : with a few words of good councel unto all people into whose hands this may come / by a follower of the Lamb through the great tribulation, John Aynsloe.
titleStmt.author: Aynsloe, John, d. 1693.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Friend's Library, London.
